provenance.note: Commissioned and acquired from Blake by Thomas Butts no later than 1805; by inheritance in 1845 to Thomas Butts, Jr.; sold Foster & Son auction, London, 29 June 1853 (£1.15s. to the dealer Henry G. Bohn); possibly Col. Gould Weston; Alexander Anderdon Weston by 1876, probably by inheritance; his widow by inheritance; sold Christie's, 28 June 1904, lot 7 (£18.18s. to the dealer E. Parsons, probably acting for W. Graham Robertson); sold from Robertson's collection, Christie's, 22 July 1949, lot 28 (£651 to the dealer Stevens and Brown acting for the dealer Charles Sessler, probably acting on behalf of Mrs. William T. Tonner); bequeathed by Tonner in 1964 to the Philadelphia Museum of Art, which received the work in 1972.

objnote.p: Blake signed the work with his monogram and dated it, lower left; see the textual transcription.

illustration.illusobjdesc: The design is based on John 3:22, with many details added to this brief reference to Christ baptizing. In the center of the design stands Christ, facing forward and looking slightly up. He wears a long gown, with both feet visible beneath the hem. His right leg is bent slightly backward and his right foot may be on tiptoe. He has long, curly hair and a beard. A halo surround his head. His left arm is at his side but bent so he can hold an infant. His right arm is raised at 45 degrees, with his palm vertical and dipped in a font of water, fingers spread slightly. He is in the act of baptizing the infant. Christ holds in his arms a nude male infant with short, curly hair. He lies on his back, facing up and looking at Christ. His legs are bent and his arms are at his side but bent with his hands together in a gesture of prayer. To the left of Christ is a stone baptismal font, pillar-like in configuration and decorated with leaf-like patterns, perhaps including acanthus. The font holds water. In front of the baptismal font stand two nude children, holding hands. The child on the left is a boy with short, curly hair. He faces right and looks slightly up, mouth open, at Christ. His right leg is bent slightly and on tiptoe. His right arm is raised horizontally. His genitals are pictured. The child on the right is a girl with long, slightly curly hair. She faces left and looks up slightly at Christ's right hand. Her left arm is raised at 45 degrees, but bent upward. On the left side of the design stands a group of ten figures in two diagonal rows. The leftmost figure in the back row is an old man with long hair and a long beard. He wears a gown and faces right. His right hand is extended in front of his chest. The figure second from the left in the back row is of indeterminable gender. It may have long hair or wear a veil over its hair. It faces right. The figure second from the right in the back row is a man with curly hair and a beard. He faces right. The rightmost figure in the back row is a female with long hair and a veil on her head. She faces right and looks forward and down, perhaps at a child. The leftmost figure in the front row is a partly nude boy, with a cloth wrapped around his shoulders, over his arms, and covering his groin. He faces forward with his arms at his side, and has short, curly hair. His right leg is bent with his right foot at tiptoe. The figure second from the left in the front row is a nude, possibly male child with short, curly hair. He is held in his mother's arms. He faces right and up, embracing his mother's head with his right arm, which is raised at 135 degrees. He may be kissing his mother as well, as his head is bent slightly back and their lips are touching. His right leg is bent slightly. The figure third from the left in the front row is a gowned female with her hair put back in a braid. Both feet are visible beneath the hem of her gown, and her left leg appears to be bent slightly. Her arms are at her side but bent, with the left arm bent slightly upward. She holds a child, probably her son, embracing him. She faces forward and looks down to the left at her son. She may be kissing him. The rightmost adult in the front row is a gowned female with her hair up in a braid and held by a band. She stands, facing right, and with her arms at her side but bent. She holds in her arms a nude child, most likely her son. The child held by the rightmost female in the front row is a nude, possibly male child with short, curly hair. He lies with his body horizontal in his mother's arms. He faces away and up and looks to the right. His right arm is at his side but bent and both legs are bent as well. The child standing on the right in the front row is a girl with long hair. She wears a long gown or cloak and faces forward and left but looks up and to the right. Her left arm is at her side and bent upward. On the right side of the design is a group of six figures in pairs. The leftmost pair consists of two gowned, kneeling children. The child on the left is a girl with long hair, facing forward and looking up and to the left. Her mouth may be partly open. At least one arm seems to be at her side and bent upward. The rightmost figure of the pair is a boy with short, curly hair. He faces left and looks up at Christ. His arms are at side and bent upward with his hands together in a gesture of prayer or supplication. The middle pair consists of a man and a woman. The leftmost figure is a gowned female with long, slightly curly hair with a veil over it. She faces forward and looks to the left at Christ. Her right arm is at her side but bent and held across her body just below her breasts. The rightmost figure is a male with short, curly hair wearing a shirt and breeches (possibly with a belt at the waist) or tights. His right leg is bent slightly with his right foot perhaps on tiptoe. He wears shoes on his feet. His left arm is at his side but bent as though hugging his body. He faces left but looks up slightly with left eye raised. The rightmost pair consists of two gowned old men with long beards. The leftmost figure of the pair has slightly curly hair and faces forward, looking left. The rightmost figure is partly bald and faces left. At the top center of the design flies a dove, facing down. Its wings are spread and it is surrounded by an aura. It likely represents the Holy Ghost. Beams of light radiate down from the top center of the design. The scene takes place in a temple, church, or baptistery with a wooden floor. Nails are visible in the wooden planks on the floor. The wall along the back has a square window at the center. A screen of pillars with arches stands in front of the background wall.
